title: rustbuild: x.py dist  should interleave tool builds

labels.name: I-compiletime
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to compile times.

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

body:
Right now doing a `x.py dist` roughly acts like this:
1) build tools deps // good parallelism
2) build tool // bad parallelism
3) thinlto tool // good parallelism
4) create dist artifact of the tool // bad parallelism 
5) proceed to next tool

steps 2 and 4 usually start initially with a number of N threads but these might be 8 or just two, and we fully wait until everything is done until processing with the next tool. 

I have an 8c/16t system and eyeballing `htop` while running `x.py dist` I would guess we could save perhaps 30%-50% wall time by `doing more stuff at the same at the same time`™ (saturating more cores).
However measurements were taken AFTER running a full `x.py build` so the heaving lifting/ building of rustc, cargo, rustfmt  and other tools.etc was already done.
